Press


  • [StrategyEye] - Hot Company Profile: Men's Ecommerce Firm BRANDiD
    Open or Close
    by Sarah Gill, London, 30th October 2012
    Boxers looking a bit threadbare? Look no further. For men who hate shopping, e-commerce firm BRANDiD has built the ultimate sartorial wingman. Users enter style preferences into its â€˜Masculine Algorithmic Learning Engine' (M.A.L.E.) and pay either a one-off, quarterly or bi-annual fee for tailored shopping delivered to their front door. If the firm gets it wrong, it simply collects the goods and the user doesn't pay a thing.

    Full article here.



  • [StrategyEye] - Twitter refers 80% of our customers, claims fashion e-commerce startup
    Open or Close
    by Sarah Gill, London, 16th October 2012
    Men's fashion startup BRANDiD claims that 80% of its customers are coming directly from Twitter, highlighting the growing role social media is playing in driving traffic to e-commerce services. Speaking to StrategyEye, CEO and co-founder Ankush Sehgal says that social media is "absolutely essential" in engaging with potential customers and pulling in traffic to its shopping service.

    Full article here.
